<item><title>Despite low net use, India's e-commerce triples in 5 years</title><description>Although India's use of the internet is lower than many poorer countries, the country's e-commerce sector tripled - or grew by 209 percent over the last five years - from $4.4 billion (Rs.20,020 crore) in 2010 to $13.6 billion (Rs.83,096 crore) in 2014. India's e-commerce market is likely to reach $38 billion (Rs.252,700 crore) in 2016, according to an Associated Chambers of Commerce & Industry of India (Assocham) report released in January 2016. The online retail sector in India is expected to be a $1 trillion (Rs.660,000 crore) market by 2020, according to a recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) and Deloitte, a consultancy.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/despite-low-net-indias-e-commerce-triples-5-055403686--finance.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 11:24:03 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ians.in/">IANS India Private Limited</source><guid isPermaLink="false">despite-low-net-indias-e-commerce-triples-5-055403686--finance</guid></item><item><title>Four new SC judges sworn-in</title><description>New Delhi, May 13 (IANS) Justice A.M. Khanwilkar, Justice D.Y. Chandrachud, Justice Ashok Bhushan and the former additional solicitor general L. Nageswara Rao were sworn-in as judges of the Supreme Court on Friday.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/four-sc-judges-sworn-052604694.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:56:04 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ians.in/">IANS India Private Limited</source><guid isPermaLink="false">four-sc-judges-sworn-052604694</guid></item><item><title>Noida: 2 former call centre staff held for stealing data, cheating customers</title><description>Three days after the inauguration of Uttar Pradesh’s first Centre for Cyber Crime Investigation (CCCI) in Noida, Gautam Budh Nagar Police arrested two former call centre employees in a case of alleged financial fraud Thursday. “The complainant, Ganesh Shanker Choudhary, approached the cyber cell and said he had received a call from a person who claimed to be a representative of IRDA. The caller told Choudhary he would receive an interest-free loan of Rs 30 lakh.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/noida-2-former-call-centre-052000022.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:50:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">noida-2-former-call-centre-052000022</guid></item><item><title>China raises Tibet Military Command's power rank</title><description>Beijing, May 13 (IANS) China has raised the rank of Tibet Military Command's authority level in an effort to strengthen its military presence in the region and for more combat assignments. The Tibet Military Command's political rank will be elevated to one level higher than its counterpart provincial-level military commands, and will come under the leadership of the People's Liberation Army (PLA), the Global Times reported on Friday. "The elevation of the authority level is not only an improvement for the troops' designation, but also an expansion of their function and mission," Zhao Zhong, deputy director of the Political Work Department of the Tibet Military Command said.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/china-raises-tibet-military-commands-power-rank-050404636.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:34:04 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ians.in/">IANS India Private Limited</source><guid isPermaLink="false">china-raises-tibet-military-commands-power-rank-050404636</guid></item><item><title>Apple announces investment in Chinese ride-hailing app</title><description>Beijing, May 13 (IANS) US tech giant Apple on Friday announced that it will invest $1 billion in Chinese ride-hailing platform, Didi Chuxing. "We decided to make the investment for a number of strategic reasons, including the chance to learn more about certain segments of the China market. Cook said the investment reflected Apple's excitement about Didi's fast-growing business and its continued confidence in China's economy in the long run.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/apple-announces-investment-chinese-ride-hailing-app-044604952.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:16:04 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ians.in/">IANS India Private Limited</source><guid isPermaLink="false">apple-announces-investment-chinese-ride-hailing-app-044604952</guid></item><item><title>After central body inspection: Deer death toll ‘as high as 46’, Delhi zoo sticks to figure 16</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/central-body-inspection-deer-death-041800018.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/isE74AUGnpoQcB2D0bqVBw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/08fd948455e97bb5f47db4fef2a0818a" width="130" height="86" alt="After central body inspection: Deer death toll ‘as high as 46’, Delhi zoo sticks to figure 16" align="left" title="After central body inspection: Deer death toll ‘as high as 46’, Delhi zoo sticks to figure 16" border="0" /></a>The number of spotted deer deaths in Delhi zoo (National Zoological Park, Delhi) this year could be as high as 46, said sources Thursday. This makes the death toll higher than the 39 initially found by a three-member Central Zoo Authority (CZA) team following an inspection of the zoo Tuesday, the sources added. Delhi zoo authorities, however, maintained their stated position of 16 spotted deer deaths - 13 prima facie tested positive for rabies and the reason for the death of the other three is yet to be ascertained.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/central-body-inspection-deer-death-041800018.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:48:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">central-body-inspection-deer-death-041800018</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/isE74AUGnpoQcB2D0bqVBw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/08fd948455e97bb5f47db4fef2a0818a" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/central-body-inspection-deer-death-041800018.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/isE74AUGnpoQcB2D0bqVBw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/08fd948455e97bb5f47db4fef2a0818a" width="130" height="86" alt="After central body inspection: Deer death toll ‘as high as 46’, Delhi zoo sticks to figure 16" align="left" title="After central body inspection: Deer death toll ‘as high as 46’, Delhi zoo sticks to figure 16" border="0" /></a>The number of spotted deer deaths in Delhi zoo (National Zoological Park, Delhi) this year could be as high as 46, said sources Thursday. This makes the death toll higher than the 39 initially found by a three-member Central Zoo Authority (CZA) team following an inspection of the zoo Tuesday, the sources added. Delhi zoo authorities, however, maintained their stated position of 16 spotted deer deaths - 13 prima facie tested positive for rabies and the reason for the death of the other three is yet to be ascertained.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Partly cloudy Friday morning in Delhi</title><description>New Delhi, May 13 (IANS) It was a partly cloudy Friday morning here with the minimum temperature recorded at 27.6 degrees Celsius, two notches above the season's average, the weather office said. "The sky will remain partly cloudy throughout the day with dust/thunderstorm likely to occur in the evening," an official of the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. According to the Met office, the maximum temperature is likely to hover around 40 degrees Celsius.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/partly-cloudy-friday-morning-delhi-041404865.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:44:04 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ians.in/">IANS India Private Limited</source><guid isPermaLink="false">partly-cloudy-friday-morning-delhi-041404865</guid></item><item><title>Punjab AAP reaches out to dairy farmers, says ‘No question of slaughtering cattle, will work for gau raksha’</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/punjab-aap-reaches-dairy-farmers-040400557.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/_zj4wkmbLQiMAJmQOgrwww--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/4951b1d3f8d1b6f6f2aab76fd6d2adcb" width="130" height="86" alt="Punjab AAP reaches out to dairy farmers, says ‘No question of slaughtering cattle, will work for gau raksha’" align="left" title="Punjab AAP reaches out to dairy farmers, says ‘No question of slaughtering cattle, will work for gau raksha’" border="0" /></a>AAP held its ‘Punjab Bolda Hai’ dialogue with dairy farmers Thursday, with the session headed by its manifesto committee head Kanwar Sandhu. Sandhu, when asked about AAP’s solution for the stray cattle problem, said, “There is no question of introducing cow slaughter in Punjab. Asked about how stray cattle will be managed then, he said, “Non-milch and infertile animals will be provided with proper shelters.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/punjab-aap-reaches-dairy-farmers-040400557.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:34:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">punjab-aap-reaches-dairy-farmers-040400557</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/_zj4wkmbLQiMAJmQOgrwww--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/4951b1d3f8d1b6f6f2aab76fd6d2adcb" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/punjab-aap-reaches-dairy-farmers-040400557.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/_zj4wkmbLQiMAJmQOgrwww--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/4951b1d3f8d1b6f6f2aab76fd6d2adcb" width="130" height="86" alt="Punjab AAP reaches out to dairy farmers, says ‘No question of slaughtering cattle, will work for gau raksha’" align="left" title="Punjab AAP reaches out to dairy farmers, says ‘No question of slaughtering cattle, will work for gau raksha’" border="0" /></a>AAP held its ‘Punjab Bolda Hai’ dialogue with dairy farmers Thursday, with the session headed by its manifesto committee head Kanwar Sandhu. Sandhu, when asked about AAP’s solution for the stray cattle problem, said, “There is no question of introducing cow slaughter in Punjab. Asked about how stray cattle will be managed then, he said, “Non-milch and infertile animals will be provided with proper shelters.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>'Pakistan's relations with US under stress for three months'</title><description>Islamabad, May 13 (IANS) Pakistan Prime Minister's Foreign Affairs Adviser Sartaj Aziz conceded that relations with the US has been under stress for the past three months because of conditions Washington had attached to the funding of F-16 fighter jets sale. The confession was made by the adviser on Thursday while concluding a debate in the Senate on an adjournment motion on the US decision to withdraw proposed subsidy on the sale of F-16 fighter jets to Pakistan, Dawn online reported. The adviser said that Pakistan-US relations had come to a standstill in 2011 because of unfortunate incidents including WikiLeaks and the Abbottabad operation where former Al Qaeda leader Osama Bin Laden was killed.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/pakistans-relations-us-under-stress-three-months-034604342.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:16:04 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ians.in/">IANS India Private Limited</source><guid isPermaLink="false">pakistans-relations-us-under-stress-three-months-034604342</guid></item><item><title>AgustaWestland chopper scam: Now, UK finds flaws in India’s request for ‘middleman’ Christian Michel’s extradition</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/agustawestland-uk-finds-flaws-india-033300741.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Q4ZMs5b1W8gGeC5IiAGiSg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/d83d985a3703a088457efa5f3f9f96a0" width="130" height="86" alt="AgustaWestland chopper scam: Now, UK finds flaws in India’s request for ‘middleman’ Christian Michel’s extradition" align="left" title="AgustaWestland chopper scam: Now, UK finds flaws in India’s request for ‘middleman’ Christian Michel’s extradition" border="0" /></a>After refusing to deport liquor baron Vijay Mallya, the United Kingdom has now found deficiencies in India’s request seeking extradition of British citizen and alleged middleman in the VVIP chopper deal, Christian Michel. Flagging the flaws, London has sent a list of queries back to India. One of these is that the extradition request does not mention the exact location of Michel in the UK, sources said.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/agustawestland-uk-finds-flaws-india-033300741.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:03:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">agustawestland-uk-finds-flaws-india-033300741</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Q4ZMs5b1W8gGeC5IiAGiSg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/d83d985a3703a088457efa5f3f9f96a0" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/agustawestland-uk-finds-flaws-india-033300741.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Q4ZMs5b1W8gGeC5IiAGiSg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/d83d985a3703a088457efa5f3f9f96a0" width="130" height="86" alt="AgustaWestland chopper scam: Now, UK finds flaws in India’s request for ‘middleman’ Christian Michel’s extradition" align="left" title="AgustaWestland chopper scam: Now, UK finds flaws in India’s request for ‘middleman’ Christian Michel’s extradition" border="0" /></a>After refusing to deport liquor baron Vijay Mallya, the United Kingdom has now found deficiencies in India’s request seeking extradition of British citizen and alleged middleman in the VVIP chopper deal, Christian Michel. Flagging the flaws, London has sent a list of queries back to India. One of these is that the extradition request does not mention the exact location of Michel in the UK, sources said.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Pune: Courts shut for summer break, deferring NEET unlikely</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/pune-courts-shut-summer-break-032100308.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/RdTeDKYkJlezkIdMU6bQVg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/782b76ad62e7c501b908d46993aef9e0" width="130" height="86" alt="Pune: Courts shut for summer break, deferring NEET unlikely" align="left" title="Pune: Courts shut for summer break, deferring NEET unlikely" border="0" /></a>WITH COURTS closing from mid May, chances are slim that there could be any further intervention on deferring the National Eligibility Entrance Examination (NEET) till next year. In Pune, all private medical colleges have scrapped their exams and at the state-level, the director of medical education and research (DMER), Dr Pravin Shingare, admits that their review petition challenging the Supreme Court ruling may not come up for hearing soon. At DY Patil deemed university, which has 14 centres across the country, including one medical college (250 seats) in Pimpri, their separate common entrance test on May 14 has been cancelled.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/pune-courts-shut-summer-break-032100308.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:51:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">pune-courts-shut-summer-break-032100308</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/RdTeDKYkJlezkIdMU6bQVg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/782b76ad62e7c501b908d46993aef9e0" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/pune-courts-shut-summer-break-032100308.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/RdTeDKYkJlezkIdMU6bQVg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/782b76ad62e7c501b908d46993aef9e0" width="130" height="86" alt="Pune: Courts shut for summer break, deferring NEET unlikely" align="left" title="Pune: Courts shut for summer break, deferring NEET unlikely" border="0" /></a>WITH COURTS closing from mid May, chances are slim that there could be any further intervention on deferring the National Eligibility Entrance Examination (NEET) till next year. In Pune, all private medical colleges have scrapped their exams and at the state-level, the director of medical education and research (DMER), Dr Pravin Shingare, admits that their review petition challenging the Supreme Court ruling may not come up for hearing soon. At DY Patil deemed university, which has 14 centres across the country, including one medical college (250 seats) in Pimpri, their separate common entrance test on May 14 has been cancelled.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Workshops by vocalist and kathak dancer: ‘Music is gateway to jannat, it connects us to Allah’</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/workshops-vocalist-kathak-dancer-music-031900529.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/33QxXJ0yUXOLC_jILrxbuA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b7d9cb8de175b054a956aadab6218ac0" width="130" height="86" alt="Workshops by vocalist and kathak dancer: ‘Music is gateway to jannat, it connects us to Allah’" align="left" title="Workshops by vocalist and kathak dancer: ‘Music is gateway to jannat, it connects us to Allah’" border="0" /></a>It is the gateway to jannat (heaven), it connects us to Allah (God),” says vocalist Amjad Ali Khan who is visiting all 113 government schools in the city as part of Workshop Demonstration (WD) programme initiated by the Government of India. Accompanied by Kathak dancer Muzaffar Ali, Khan aims to imbibe and impart the knowledge of Indian classical art forms amongst the students. Not many are exposed to the beauty of classical music.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/workshops-vocalist-kathak-dancer-music-031900529.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:49:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">workshops-vocalist-kathak-dancer-music-031900529</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/33QxXJ0yUXOLC_jILrxbuA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b7d9cb8de175b054a956aadab6218ac0" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/workshops-vocalist-kathak-dancer-music-031900529.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/33QxXJ0yUXOLC_jILrxbuA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b7d9cb8de175b054a956aadab6218ac0" width="130" height="86" alt="Workshops by vocalist and kathak dancer: ‘Music is gateway to jannat, it connects us to Allah’" align="left" title="Workshops by vocalist and kathak dancer: ‘Music is gateway to jannat, it connects us to Allah’" border="0" /></a>It is the gateway to jannat (heaven), it connects us to Allah (God),” says vocalist Amjad Ali Khan who is visiting all 113 government schools in the city as part of Workshop Demonstration (WD) programme initiated by the Government of India. Accompanied by Kathak dancer Muzaffar Ali, Khan aims to imbibe and impart the knowledge of Indian classical art forms amongst the students. Not many are exposed to the beauty of classical music.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Graft charge against under secy: MHA to scan Foreigners Division for irregularities</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/graft-charge-against-under-secy-031700399.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/KHZH5YfSupQNem.GT_zZNw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/d3c723e0eb44d83c374ee95c63d95405" width="130" height="86" alt="Delhi police look for ‘missing’ Home Ministry official, Anand Joshi" align="left" title="Delhi police look for ‘missing’ Home Ministry official, Anand Joshi" border="0" /></a>After the CBI lodged a corruption case against a Home Ministry under secretary for allegedly trading FCRA information with NGOs and arbitrarily issuing notices to some of them to extract money, sources said Thursday that the ministry could initiate a departmental inquiry into alleged irregularities in its Foreigners Division that deals with FCRA violation by NGOs. A top Home Ministry official said the ministry was waiting for a report from CBI, following which a departmental inquiry would be initiated to examine the whole issue. Sources said the Ministry wants to ensure that all sensitive files and documents pertaining to Foreigners Division are accounted for and are in safe custody, especially secret documents from Intelligence Bureau on the activities of NGOs.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/graft-charge-against-under-secy-031700399.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:47:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">graft-charge-against-under-secy-031700399</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/KHZH5YfSupQNem.GT_zZNw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/d3c723e0eb44d83c374ee95c63d95405" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/graft-charge-against-under-secy-031700399.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/KHZH5YfSupQNem.GT_zZNw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/d3c723e0eb44d83c374ee95c63d95405" width="130" height="86" alt="Delhi police look for ‘missing’ Home Ministry official, Anand Joshi" align="left" title="Delhi police look for ‘missing’ Home Ministry official, Anand Joshi" border="0" /></a>After the CBI lodged a corruption case against a Home Ministry under secretary for allegedly trading FCRA information with NGOs and arbitrarily issuing notices to some of them to extract money, sources said Thursday that the ministry could initiate a departmental inquiry into alleged irregularities in its Foreigners Division that deals with FCRA violation by NGOs. A top Home Ministry official said the ministry was waiting for a report from CBI, following which a departmental inquiry would be initiated to examine the whole issue. Sources said the Ministry wants to ensure that all sensitive files and documents pertaining to Foreigners Division are accounted for and are in safe custody, especially secret documents from Intelligence Bureau on the activities of NGOs.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Between the lines of Tina Dabi’s IAS success story: Individual excellence and social change</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/between-lines-tina-dabi-ias-025700688.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/NY8D_PTpUCCPl9mPgO0Wyw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/dd1972e76fa32255b91fdbdbbd0a7e04" width="130" height="86" alt="Between the lines of Tina Dabi’s IAS success story: Individual excellence and social change" align="left" title="Between the lines of Tina Dabi’s IAS success story: Individual excellence and social change" border="0" /></a>Tina Dabi, the IAS Topper this year, is gracious and calm despite the pressures of the moment. width="130" height="86" alt="SC seeks Centre’s reply on appointing more judges" align="left" title="SC seeks Centre’s reply on appointing more judges" border="0" /></a>The Supreme Court Thursday sought Centre’s response on a PIL seeking a direction for doubling the number of judges as recommended by the Law Commission. A bench led by Chief Justice T S Thakur issued notices to the Ministry of Law &amp; Justice and Ministry of Finance on a plea filed by BJP leader and lawyer Ashwani Kumar Upadhyay. The PIL has also sought a direction to implement the resolution of the advisory council of the National Mission for Justice Delivery and Legal Reforms.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>India negotiating exchange rate, interest on Iran oil dues</title><description>India and Iran are still in negotiations regarding the currency conversion rate and interest rate for clearing billions of dollars of dues that Indian oil firms owe to Tehran for buying crude oil since 2012, before economic sanctions were lifted on Iran, a top finance ministry official said. On both the issues of exchange rate and interest rate, it is still on,” he said. The negotiations are also being undertaken by the Indian oil refiners with the Iranian firms on the payment route details including selection of bank and the countries through which India will route the pending dues.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/india-negotiating-exchange-rate-interest-022500821.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:55:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">india-negotiating-exchange-rate-interest-022500821</guid></item><item><title>India, Mauritius to tax fee for technical services through new article in pact</title><description>Adding a new article to the revised tax treaty between India and Mauritius, the governments of both countries have decided to tax fee for technical services at a rate not exceeding 10 per cent of the gross amount of the fee. “Fees for technical services arising in a contracting state and paid to a resident of the other contracting state may be taxed in that other state,” says the protocol amending the tax treaty between India and Mauritius.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/india-mauritius-tax-fee-technical-022000351.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:50:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">india-mauritius-tax-fee-technical-022000351</guid></item><item><title>RBI to slap higher provisioning for large corporate borrowers</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/rbi-slap-higher-provisioning-large-020800973.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/LnGu5LsL3ztl9xuDLlNq3A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/8614352208eccc4c0aa15100865f7e3f" width="130" height="86" alt="RBI to slap higher provisioning for large corporate borrowers" align="left" title="RBI to slap higher provisioning for large corporate borrowers" border="0" /></a>The Reserve Bank of India on Thursday said that Indian banks would have to make higher provisions for lending to large corporate borrowers above a certain level from next financial year in order to avoid a build-up of high concentration of credit risk at the systemic level. The move follows an RBI study which found “many large corporates are excessively leveraged and banking sector’s aggregate exposure towards such companies is also excessively high”. The proposals were set out by the central bank in a discussion paper and aimed at “mitigating the risk posed to the banking system on account of large aggregate lending to a single corporate”, according to the RBI document.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/rbi-slap-higher-provisioning-large-020800973.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:38:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">rbi-slap-higher-provisioning-large-020800973</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/LnGu5LsL3ztl9xuDLlNq3A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/8614352208eccc4c0aa15100865f7e3f" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/rbi-slap-higher-provisioning-large-020800973.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/LnGu5LsL3ztl9xuDLlNq3A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/8614352208eccc4c0aa15100865f7e3f" width="130" height="86" alt="RBI to slap higher provisioning for large corporate borrowers" align="left" title="RBI to slap higher provisioning for large corporate borrowers" border="0" /></a>The Reserve Bank of India on Thursday said that Indian banks would have to make higher provisions for lending to large corporate borrowers above a certain level from next financial year in order to avoid a build-up of high concentration of credit risk at the systemic level. The move follows an RBI study which found “many large corporates are excessively leveraged and banking sector’s aggregate exposure towards such companies is also excessively high”. The proposals were set out by the central bank in a discussion paper and aimed at “mitigating the risk posed to the banking system on account of large aggregate lending to a single corporate”, according to the RBI document.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>PMO directs ASI to acquire land at Masoul to resume excavation</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/pmo-directs-asi-acquire-land-015800262.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/3f_ehaC0CGQzVLIp8RrfWQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/a02c64ec70f1a8c3f0b5fb4fcb7bfe23" width="130" height="86" alt="PMO directs ASI to acquire land at Masoul to resume excavation" align="left" title="PMO directs ASI to acquire land at Masoul to resume excavation" border="0" /></a>THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL Survey of India (ASI) has expedited the process of acquiring land at Masoul village for resuming the excavation of fossils. The fossils found at Masoul village are said to be among the oldest found in the world so far. According to a senior official of ASI, PMO became interested in the site after French President Francois Hollande’s visit to Chandigarh when some of the fossils were placed in the government museum to show these to the visiting president.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/pmo-directs-asi-acquire-land-015800262.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:28:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">pmo-directs-asi-acquire-land-015800262</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/3f_ehaC0CGQzVLIp8RrfWQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/a02c64ec70f1a8c3f0b5fb4fcb7bfe23" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/pmo-directs-asi-acquire-land-015800262.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/3f_ehaC0CGQzVLIp8RrfWQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/a02c64ec70f1a8c3f0b5fb4fcb7bfe23" width="130" height="86" alt="PMO directs ASI to acquire land at Masoul to resume excavation" align="left" title="PMO directs ASI to acquire land at Masoul to resume excavation" border="0" /></a>THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL Survey of India (ASI) has expedited the process of acquiring land at Masoul village for resuming the excavation of fossils. The fossils found at Masoul village are said to be among the oldest found in the world so far. According to a senior official of ASI, PMO became interested in the site after French President Francois Hollande’s visit to Chandigarh when some of the fossils were placed in the government museum to show these to the visiting president.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Call drops: Bharti Airtel sets benchmark at 1.5 per cent</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/call-drops-bharti-airtel-sets-014400677.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/TfuHB01t5X5D59HyMs7y_w--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/59f98f57ece21d9699d70649e0d80cc7" width="130" height="86" alt="Call drops: Bharti Airtel sets benchmark at 1.5 per cent" align="left" title="Call drops: Bharti Airtel sets benchmark at 1.5 per cent" border="0" /></a>Compared with the Trai prescribed norm of 2 per cent cap on call drops, Bharti has set itself a benchmark of maximum of 1.5 per cent call drops. In a statement, Airtel said it would contribute towards rural education Rs 1 lakh for every 0.01 per cent increase in call drop rate beyond 1.5 per cent every month in each circle of operation, subject to a maximum of Rs 100 crore per annum.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/call-drops-bharti-airtel-sets-014400677.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:14:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">call-drops-bharti-airtel-sets-014400677</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/TfuHB01t5X5D59HyMs7y_w--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/59f98f57ece21d9699d70649e0d80cc7" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/call-drops-bharti-airtel-sets-014400677.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/TfuHB01t5X5D59HyMs7y_w--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/59f98f57ece21d9699d70649e0d80cc7" width="130" height="86" alt="Call drops: Bharti Airtel sets benchmark at 1.5 per cent" align="left" title="Call drops: Bharti Airtel sets benchmark at 1.5 per cent" border="0" /></a>Compared with the Trai prescribed norm of 2 per cent cap on call drops, Bharti has set itself a benchmark of maximum of 1.5 per cent call drops. In a statement, Airtel said it would contribute towards rural education Rs 1 lakh for every 0.01 per cent increase in call drop rate beyond 1.5 per cent every month in each circle of operation, subject to a maximum of Rs 100 crore per annum.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Our parampara is to send quota winner, says WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/parampara-send-quota-winner-says-013700903.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/V3JlmUa8MfJtsdVHtox_XQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/cd0e3e5282df6d221cffab518cab32ec" width="130" height="86" alt="Our parampara is to send quota winner, says WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh" align="left" title="Our parampara is to send quota winner, says WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh" border="0" /></a>The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) all but quashed Sushil Kumar’s hopes that selection trials would be conducted to choose between him and Narsingh Yadav for the solitary spot in the 74kg category at the Rio Olympics. The federation’s president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh said it would conduct trials if the sports ministry would ask them to. “On one hand, we have the future of India’s most decorated wrestler and on the other, we have our parampara and rules.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/parampara-send-quota-winner-says-013700903.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:07:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">parampara-send-quota-winner-says-013700903</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/V3JlmUa8MfJtsdVHtox_XQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/cd0e3e5282df6d221cffab518cab32ec" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/parampara-send-quota-winner-says-013700903.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/V3JlmUa8MfJtsdVHtox_XQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/cd0e3e5282df6d221cffab518cab32ec" width="130" height="86" alt="Our parampara is to send quota winner, says WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh" align="left" title="Our parampara is to send quota winner, says WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh" border="0" /></a>The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) all but quashed Sushil Kumar’s hopes that selection trials would be conducted to choose between him and Narsingh Yadav for the solitary spot in the 74kg category at the Rio Olympics. The federation’s president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh said it would conduct trials if the sports ministry would ask them to. “On one hand, we have the future of India’s most decorated wrestler and on the other, we have our parampara and rules.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Administrative structures to be in place as ‘early as possible’: Shaktikanta Das</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/administrative-structures-place-early-possible-013100217.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lpDM3wDelVF6HcApleNXTg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/db9bbde49d2d9b973cb01475216bd343" width="130" height="86" alt="Administrative structures to be in place as ‘early as possible’: Shaktikanta Das" align="left" title="Administrative structures to be in place as ‘early as possible’: Shaktikanta Das" border="0" /></a>The government is working expeditiously on framing rules and regulations for the new Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2015, and will create all administrative structures related to it as “early as possible”, Economic Affairs Secretary Shaktikanta Das said. The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2015, was cleared by Parliament on Wednesday. The statement added that the Bankruptcy Code “would take India from among relatively weak insolvency regimes to becoming one of the world’s best insolvency regimes”.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/administrative-structures-place-early-possible-013100217.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:01:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">administrative-structures-place-early-possible-013100217</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lpDM3wDelVF6HcApleNXTg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/db9bbde49d2d9b973cb01475216bd343" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/administrative-structures-place-early-possible-013100217.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lpDM3wDelVF6HcApleNXTg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/db9bbde49d2d9b973cb01475216bd343" width="130" height="86" alt="Administrative structures to be in place as ‘early as possible’: Shaktikanta Das" align="left" title="Administrative structures to be in place as ‘early as possible’: Shaktikanta Das" border="0" /></a>The government is working expeditiously on framing rules and regulations for the new Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2015, and will create all administrative structures related to it as “early as possible”, Economic Affairs Secretary Shaktikanta Das said. The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2015, was cleared by Parliament on Wednesday. The statement added that the Bankruptcy Code “would take India from among relatively weak insolvency regimes to becoming one of the world’s best insolvency regimes”.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Will take a call on raising Rs 25K limit once PSBs exhaust it: Vinod Rai</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/call-raising-rs-25k-limit-012300611.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/IeeE3ed7olUGWuX1wvGUQw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b48a32e69ac67b31cfd4dcab76d4e863" width="130" height="86" alt="Will take a call on raising Rs 25K limit once PSBs exhaust it: Vinod Rai" align="left" title="Will take a call on raising Rs 25K limit once PSBs exhaust it: Vinod Rai" border="0" /></a>The government is working on capital infusion plan for public sector banks and will decide on raising the amount after Rs 25000 crore provided in the Budget for 2016-17 is exhausted, Bank Board Bureau chairman Vinod Rai said on Thursday. “Let the government first disburse (Rs) 25,000 crore that it has provided for this year then after the banks results, if need be, then we will look at how much more is required,” Rai said after a meeting of the Bureau. The government will provide capital based on three parameters — capital adequacy, performance of the banks and projected capital growth.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/call-raising-rs-25k-limit-012300611.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:53:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">call-raising-rs-25k-limit-012300611</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/IeeE3ed7olUGWuX1wvGUQw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b48a32e69ac67b31cfd4dcab76d4e863" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/call-raising-rs-25k-limit-012300611.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/IeeE3ed7olUGWuX1wvGUQw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b48a32e69ac67b31cfd4dcab76d4e863" width="130" height="86" alt="Will take a call on raising Rs 25K limit once PSBs exhaust it: Vinod Rai" align="left" title="Will take a call on raising Rs 25K limit once PSBs exhaust it: Vinod Rai" border="0" /></a>The government is working on capital infusion plan for public sector banks and will decide on raising the amount after Rs 25000 crore provided in the Budget for 2016-17 is exhausted, Bank Board Bureau chairman Vinod Rai said on Thursday. “Let the government first disburse (Rs) 25,000 crore that it has provided for this year then after the banks results, if need be, then we will look at how much more is required,” Rai said after a meeting of the Bureau. The government will provide capital based on three parameters — capital adequacy, performance of the banks and projected capital growth.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>BCCI paid Rs 2.62 crore to India ‘A’, U-19 coach Rahul Dravid</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/bcci-paid-rs-2-62-012200408.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/PuIhwh0K7fSXhad.L4Bhyw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/c303f5123b8fcc3eba3f03c6e2d7a9cc" width="130" height="86" alt="BCCI paid Rs 2.62 crore to India ‘A’, U-19 coach Rahul Dravid" align="left" title="BCCI paid Rs 2.62 crore to India ‘A’, U-19 coach Rahul Dravid" border="0" /></a>GETTING RAHUL Dravid on board as junior coach was one of BCCI’s pricier expenditures in terms of hiring personnel. According to the board’s payments details (over Rs 25 lakh only) released on their official website for April 2016, the former India captain was roped in for a professional fee of nearly Rs 2.62 crore — the second-half of which, around Rs 1.3 crore, was paid to him on April 2. It would seem like money well spent considering the significant impact that Dravid had on both the India A and U-19 teams that he coached since taking up the role last year.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/bcci-paid-rs-2-62-012200408.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:52:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">bcci-paid-rs-2-62-012200408</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/PuIhwh0K7fSXhad.L4Bhyw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/c303f5123b8fcc3eba3f03c6e2d7a9cc" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/bcci-paid-rs-2-62-012200408.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/PuIhwh0K7fSXhad.L4Bhyw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/c303f5123b8fcc3eba3f03c6e2d7a9cc" width="130" height="86" alt="BCCI paid Rs 2.62 crore to India ‘A’, U-19 coach Rahul Dravid" align="left" title="BCCI paid Rs 2.62 crore to India ‘A’, U-19 coach Rahul Dravid" border="0" /></a>GETTING RAHUL Dravid on board as junior coach was one of BCCI’s pricier expenditures in terms of hiring personnel. According to the board’s payments details (over Rs 25 lakh only) released on their official website for April 2016, the former India captain was roped in for a professional fee of nearly Rs 2.62 crore — the second-half of which, around Rs 1.3 crore, was paid to him on April 2. It would seem like money well spent considering the significant impact that Dravid had on both the India A and U-19 teams that he coached since taking up the role last year.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Mumbai residents form groups to gear up for civic polls</title><description>WITH the Mumbai civic elections due early next year, it’s not only the political parties that have started preparations. “We had an informal discussion with various independent groups to discuss the strategy for elections. The people are disappointed with the current dispensation in the BMC and the way they are functioning,” said Hansel D’Souza of Mumbai Nagrik Manch.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/mumbai-residents-form-groups-gear-011700835.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:47:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">mumbai-residents-form-groups-gear-011700835</guid></item><item><title>Gwalior, Allahabad, Patna, Raipur among world’s most polluted cities</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/gwalior-allahabad-patna-raipur-among-010600167.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/rXAzGB.Md81e4Tcysn131A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/ea5febb0f55735e536223258d39612e6" width="130" height="86" alt="Gwalior, Allahabad, Patna, Raipur among world’s most polluted cities" align="left" title="Gwalior, Allahabad, Patna, Raipur among world’s most polluted cities" border="0" /></a>THE WORLD Health Organisation’s urban air quality database for 2016 might have shown a decline in PM 2.5 levels in Delhi since 2014, but it is not all good news for other cities in India. According to the report for 2016 released by WHO on Thursday, India’s Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, which have far poorer air quality monitoring systems, are already among the global cities with the highest levels of particulate matter (PM). Gwalior, among the top five cities globally in terms of PM 2.5 levels, recorded an annual average of 176 micrograms per cubic metre (ug/m3) and Allahabad 170.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/gwalior-allahabad-patna-raipur-among-010600167.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:36:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">gwalior-allahabad-patna-raipur-among-010600167</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/rXAzGB.Md81e4Tcysn131A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/ea5febb0f55735e536223258d39612e6" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/gwalior-allahabad-patna-raipur-among-010600167.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/rXAzGB.Md81e4Tcysn131A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/ea5febb0f55735e536223258d39612e6" width="130" height="86" alt="Gwalior, Allahabad, Patna, Raipur among world’s most polluted cities" align="left" title="Gwalior, Allahabad, Patna, Raipur among world’s most polluted cities" border="0" /></a>THE WORLD Health Organisation’s urban air quality database for 2016 might have shown a decline in PM 2.5 levels in Delhi since 2014, but it is not all good news for other cities in India. According to the report for 2016 released by WHO on Thursday, India’s Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, which have far poorer air quality monitoring systems, are already among the global cities with the highest levels of particulate matter (PM). Gwalior, among the top five cities globally in terms of PM 2.5 levels, recorded an annual average of 176 micrograms per cubic metre (ug/m3) and Allahabad 170.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Set up SIT on wife-swapping charge in Navy: SC to Kerala cops</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/set-sit-wife-swapping-charge-010000579.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/9Z4q.5peOT6A4UnmDqMgFw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b8ab007cd1812b636aec779f8feaba62" width="130" height="86" alt="SC seeks Centre’s reply on appointing more judges" align="left" title="SC seeks Centre’s reply on appointing more judges" border="0" /></a>THE SUPREME Court Thursday directed the Kerala Police to set up a special investigation team (SIT) to be headed by a deputy inspector general rank officer, to probe allegations of wife-swapping among Indian Navy officers. A bench led by Chief Justice of India T S Thakur declined a plea filed by the estranged wife of an accused Naval officer for a a CBI probe into the charges and asked the state police to complete the probe, preferably within three months. “The facts and circumstances in which the offence is alleged to have been committed can be better investigated by the state police,” said the bench, after taking into account an argument by the Kerala Police that 70 witnesses had already been examined in the matter.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/set-sit-wife-swapping-charge-010000579.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:30:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">set-sit-wife-swapping-charge-010000579</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/9Z4q.5peOT6A4UnmDqMgFw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b8ab007cd1812b636aec779f8feaba62" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/set-sit-wife-swapping-charge-010000579.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/9Z4q.5peOT6A4UnmDqMgFw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b8ab007cd1812b636aec779f8feaba62" width="130" height="86" alt="SC seeks Centre’s reply on appointing more judges" align="left" title="SC seeks Centre’s reply on appointing more judges" border="0" /></a>THE SUPREME Court Thursday directed the Kerala Police to set up a special investigation team (SIT) to be headed by a deputy inspector general rank officer, to probe allegations of wife-swapping among Indian Navy officers. A bench led by Chief Justice of India T S Thakur declined a plea filed by the estranged wife of an accused Naval officer for a a CBI probe into the charges and asked the state police to complete the probe, preferably within three months. “The facts and circumstances in which the offence is alleged to have been committed can be better investigated by the state police,” said the bench, after taking into account an argument by the Kerala Police that 70 witnesses had already been examined in the matter.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>ED seeks Interpol Red Corner notice against Vijay Mallya</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/ed-seeks-interpol-red-corner-135500573.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/DnboFQmZf.Gqc3MNbkW2ow--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/81c7220f83acada6009a43f95fa94815" width="130" height="86" alt="ED seeks Interpol Red Corner notice against Vijay Mallya" align="left" title="ED seeks Interpol Red Corner notice against Vijay Mallya" border="0" /></a>WITH THE United Kingdom declining India’s request to deport Vijay Mallya, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has requested Interpol to issue a Red Corner Notice against him in connection with its money laundering probe, official sources said on Thursday. A Red Corner Notice is issued to arrest and extradite offenders to the country where they are wanted. The ED has sent its request to the CBI, the nodal agency for Interpol-related affairs in India.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/ed-seeks-interpol-red-corner-135500573.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:00:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">ed-seeks-interpol-red-corner-135500573</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/DnboFQmZf.Gqc3MNbkW2ow--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/81c7220f83acada6009a43f95fa94815" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/ed-seeks-interpol-red-corner-135500573.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/DnboFQmZf.Gqc3MNbkW2ow--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/81c7220f83acada6009a43f95fa94815" width="130" height="86" alt="ED seeks Interpol Red Corner notice against Vijay Mallya" align="left" title="ED seeks Interpol Red Corner notice against Vijay Mallya" border="0" /></a>WITH THE United Kingdom declining India’s request to deport Vijay Mallya, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has requested Interpol to issue a Red Corner Notice against him in connection with its money laundering probe, official sources said on Thursday. A Red Corner Notice is issued to arrest and extradite offenders to the country where they are wanted. The ED has sent its request to the CBI, the nodal agency for Interpol-related affairs in India.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>New ICC chairman Shashank Manohar read the moment well, made the right move</title><description>Two days after he sent in his resignation as BCCI president from the cool climes of Mahabaleshwar where he was vacationing, Shashank Manohar has smoothly slid into the chairman’s chair at the ICC. Neither the resignation after the shortest tenure in BCCI’s history nor the ICC role – he was elected unopposed through a secret ballot by the ICC — was an unsurprising development. There are two camps of views regarding Manohar’s stint with the BCCI.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/shashank-manohar-elected-unopposed-independent-112800985.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:58:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">shashank-manohar-elected-unopposed-independent-112800985</guid></item><item><title>Literature of Languages</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/literature-languages-001200129.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/3DIswylsWJgVxC9CX.VkYA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b940bf127a776a5ae3531a126474b963" width="130" height="86" alt="Literature of Languages" align="left" title="Literature of Languages" border="0" /></a>There is one detail that binds Rabindranath Tagore with Saadat Hasan Manto — both were born in May. Advertising veteran Jameel Gulrays has used this seemingly unimportant detail as an excuse to present select works of the masters to the people in Mumbai. Through his initiative Katha Kathan, Gulrays and his team will present dramatised readings of Tagore’s Kabuliwala and Manto’s Taraqqi Pasand.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Speaking up, saying it out loud</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/speaking-saying-loud-001000939.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/qWaEcRnEH0JMnZMUSXGx1A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/0372c805d30edbb71a0d8ba63ffcb179" width="130" height="86" alt="Speaking up, saying it out loud" align="left" title="Speaking up, saying it out loud" border="0" /></a>It is good news when the media begins to report honestly in Pakistan, not hiding news it doesn’t like or fears. The first, in January, succeeded in reducing pollution by about 10-13 per cent, as we showed in a previous article (‘Yes, Delhi, it worked’, The Indian Express, January 19).</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/april-wasn-t-january-000500764.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:35:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">april-wasn-t-january-000500764</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/yd8m6mxSeH02_U3vYO5WqA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/727a2c3c122b77f5b7ce0fd3556b7aad" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/april-wasn-t-january-000500764.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/yd8m6mxSeH02_U3vYO5WqA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/727a2c3c122b77f5b7ce0fd3556b7aad" width="130" height="86" alt="April wasn’t January" align="left" title="April wasn’t January" border="0" /></a>Delhi has now had two encounters with the odd-even pilot experiment. The first, in January, succeeded in reducing pollution by about 10-13 per cent, as we showed in a previous article (‘Yes, Delhi, it worked’, The Indian Express, January 19).</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Not Without Reservations</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/not-without-reservations-000200893.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/fOGZkZuL0oRycgfyDJDbfQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/14bb07359d084d6589539dca4e5ddf93" width="130" height="86" alt="Not Without Reservations" align="left" title="Not Without Reservations" border="0" /></a>Napoleon Bonaparte said “ability is nothing without opportunity”. This assertion describes the case of Tina Dabi, who has topped the civil services examination 2015 at the age of 22. Dabi has not availed of the quota, but reservation has provided the opportunities, of which her triumph is the byproduct.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/not-without-reservations-000200893.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:32:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">not-without-reservations-000200893</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/fOGZkZuL0oRycgfyDJDbfQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/14bb07359d084d6589539dca4e5ddf93" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/not-without-reservations-000200893.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/fOGZkZuL0oRycgfyDJDbfQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/14bb07359d084d6589539dca4e5ddf93" width="130" height="86" alt="Not Without Reservations" align="left" title="Not Without Reservations" border="0" /></a>Napoleon Bonaparte said “ability is nothing without opportunity”. This assertion describes the case of Tina Dabi, who has topped the civil services examination 2015 at the age of 22. Dabi has not availed of the quota, but reservation has provided the opportunities, of which her triumph is the byproduct.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Bankruptcy Code: Creative destruction</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/bankruptcy-code-creative-destruction-000100332.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/wR_UBRdJQDbi4iGmw4levw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/4caf3732073dfe4da0dc7717c50ce682" width="130" height="86" alt="Bankruptcy Code: Creative destruction" align="left" title="Bankruptcy Code: Creative destruction" border="0" /></a>In a welcome break from the logjams in the Upper House that have held back crucial economic reforms such as the GST, the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday passed the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code 2016. When it comes to “resolving insolvency”, India ranks an abysmal 136 out of 189 countries according to the Doing Business 2016 report. On average, secured creditors in India recover only 25.7 cents for every dollar of credit from an insolvent firm at the end of insolvency proceedings and the whole process takes 4.3 years to conclude.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/bankruptcy-code-creative-destruction-000100332.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:31:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">bankruptcy-code-creative-destruction-000100332</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/wR_UBRdJQDbi4iGmw4levw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/4caf3732073dfe4da0dc7717c50ce682" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/bankruptcy-code-creative-destruction-000100332.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/wR_UBRdJQDbi4iGmw4levw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/4caf3732073dfe4da0dc7717c50ce682" width="130" height="86" alt="Bankruptcy Code: Creative destruction" align="left" title="Bankruptcy Code: Creative destruction" border="0" /></a>In a welcome break from the logjams in the Upper House that have held back crucial economic reforms such as the GST, the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday passed the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code 2016. When it comes to “resolving insolvency”, India ranks an abysmal 136 out of 189 countries according to the Doing Business 2016 report. On average, secured creditors in India recover only 25.7 cents for every dollar of credit from an insolvent firm at the end of insolvency proceedings and the whole process takes 4.3 years to conclude.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Ken-Betwa river linking project: Recalling an old idea whose time may have come</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/ken-betwa-river-linking-project-000100795.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/6CwMVHx_4RyT0KJcOWKZRg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/29405f9439c896aa6c73c961381cac71" width="130" height="86" alt="Ken-Betwa river linking project: Recalling an old idea whose time may have come" align="left" title="Ken-Betwa river linking project: Recalling an old idea whose time may have come" border="0" /></a>During the Raj, British engineer Sir Arthur Cotton sought to link the Ganga and the Cauvery to facilitate navigation. In 1982, the National Water Development Agency (NWDA) was formed, and entrusted with the task of carrying out water balance and feasibility studies of the linking programme of 30 rivers. The idea gathered steam under the Atal Bihari Vajpayee government.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/ken-betwa-river-linking-project-000100795.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:31:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">ken-betwa-river-linking-project-000100795</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/6CwMVHx_4RyT0KJcOWKZRg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/29405f9439c896aa6c73c961381cac71" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/ken-betwa-river-linking-project-000100795.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/6CwMVHx_4RyT0KJcOWKZRg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/29405f9439c896aa6c73c961381cac71" width="130" height="86" alt="Ken-Betwa river linking project: Recalling an old idea whose time may have come" align="left" title="Ken-Betwa river linking project: Recalling an old idea whose time may have come" border="0" /></a>During the Raj, British engineer Sir Arthur Cotton sought to link the Ganga and the Cauvery to facilitate navigation. In 1982, the National Water Development Agency (NWDA) was formed, and entrusted with the task of carrying out water balance and feasibility studies of the linking programme of 30 rivers. The idea gathered steam under the Atal Bihari Vajpayee government.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Nitish flays Modi & BJP in Varanasi</title><description>LAUNCHING a scathing attack on the BJP and PM Narendra Modi on his home turf Varanasi on Thursday, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said there is a lot of difference between the words and actions of these people. Though his speech was focused on roughing up the BJP, the RSS and Modi, he surprisingly spared his old friend and Samajwadi Party supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav. “ The people of Varanasi have seen ( in the past two years) that what were their expectations from him ( Modi) and what he has.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/nitish-flays-modi-bjp-varanasi-000000847.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:30:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://epaper.mailtoday.in/epaperhome.aspx?issue=3112010">Mail Today</source><guid isPermaLink="false">nitish-flays-modi-bjp-varanasi-000000847</guid></item><item><title>Woman says IAS officer abused & threatened her</title><description>The Lalit Kala Akademi officer has alleged that KK Mittal, an undersecretary in the Union culture ministry and also the institution’s administrator, insulted and threatened to suspend her for not clearing funds, which she says would have been against the rules. The victim has also filed a complaint with the National Commission for Women ( NCW). Activists say though economic liberalisation in India has brought with it progressive ideas of gender equality, women continue to face a slew of threats at workplaces based on traditional patriarchal beliefs.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/woman-says-ias-officer-abused-000000775.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:30:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://epaper.mailtoday.in/epaperhome.aspx?issue=3112010">Mail Today</source><guid isPermaLink="false">woman-says-ias-officer-abused-000000775</guid></item><item><title>CJI: Double the number of judges</title><description>WITH AN astounding three crore plus case pendency staring him in the face, Chief Justice of India T S Thakur on Thursday issued a notice to the Centre on a PIL which sought immediate directions to double the number of judges in the country as recommended by the Law Commission in its 245th report. It is to be noted that a fortnight after his impassioned appeal to Prime Minister Narendra Modi over shortage of judges at the state Chief Justices and Chief Ministers conference, the Chief Justice had on May 9 said courts in the country now require more than 70,000 judges to clear the pending cases. The petitioner, a Supreme Court lawyer Ashwini Upadhyay said in his plea: “ Judicial reform is not only necessary to secure fundamental right of fair trial and speedy justice to every citizen under Article 21 of the Constitution but also essential to control the prevailing corruption, crime, casteism and communalism.” “ The Union government and State Governments had agreed to double the number of judges in Chief Justices and Chief Ministers conference 2013,” it said.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/cji-double-number-judges-000000695.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:30:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://epaper.mailtoday.in/epaperhome.aspx?issue=3112010">Mail Today</source><guid isPermaLink="false">cji-double-number-judges-000000695</guid></item><item><title>ISIS global recruiters set sights on India</title><description>DISCLOSURES of recently- arrested ISIS recruits have revealed that the jihadi group’s global headhunters including women from Argentina, Sri Lanka and Philippines are on the prowl for Indian youth who show any leanings to radical views on social media. Counter- terror agencies are closely monitoring nearly 25 motivators, mostly from outside India, who are looking for potential recruits and then indoctrinating them on social media. Sources said the three women who are on hiring spree for the Sunni terror group identify themselves as Karen from Philippines, Fatima from Argentina and Eje from Sri Lanka.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/isis-global-recruiters-set-sights-000000454.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:30:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://epaper.mailtoday.in/epaperhome.aspx?issue=3112010">Mail Today</source><guid isPermaLink="false">isis-global-recruiters-set-sights-000000454</guid></item></channel>
